page.title: 16NARROW GUAGE RAILWAY L. B.
page.content: Originally built to carry sand from the sand quarries to the main line station. The little two foot guage railway winds its way through uniquely varied surroundings from the terminus at Page's Park, past a sand quarry trough new housing estates and industrial areas to open countryside, at one point travelling up a 1:24 gradient. The return trip takes 1 hour 10 mins and covers 5.5 miles. A passenger service commenced in 1967 when enthusiasts realising its historical importance and potential formed a society to protect itb and provide a public service. The track has been rebuilt and coaches, stations, and engine sheds have been built. Signals and safety equipment have been installed and a collection of unique steam and diesel locomotives has been built up.
